sentence.text: Biallelic loss-of-function mutations in the RNA-binding protein mRNA splicing, via spliceosome cause Richieri-Costa-Pereira syndrome (RCPS), an autosomal recessive condition mainly characterized by craniofacial and limb malformations.
mRNA splicing, via spliceosome haploinsufficient embryos presented altered mandibular process fusion and micrognathia, thus recapitulating the most penetrant phenotypes of the syndrome.
